page.title: 15Land Ownership, and Sapiston
page.content:
Much land locally is owned by the Duke of Grafton, based at Euston Hall, a few miles up the road. It is mainly farmland, with some residential property. Much of the rest of the land is owned by the local charity, formerly the Churchwardens of the Parish. Some fields, allotments, and a playing field are available for use.
The village of Sapiston is separated from Honington by the Black Bourn, over a narrow hump-backed bridge, with a new footbridge adjoining. Sapiston has mainly residential property with a village hall, used by residents of both villages, for a youth club, Over 60s, and Women's Institute.
